isis.stitle: ANTILOCK BRAKES/TRACTION CONTROL: BENDIX - PRINCIPLES, OPERATION AND SERVICE - OPERATION - ABS WARNING LIGHT

svcprocinfo.para: The ABS controller uses the warning light relay to control the ABS warning light.

svcsubproc.title: Warning Light
svcsubproc.para: The antilock warning light is located in the right gauge cluster. When the vehicle is started, the "Initial Start-up Self Diagnostic Test" will be run. The yellow warning light also will illuminate if during this test or normal operation, the controller senses a system defect.

svcsubproc.title: Warning Light Relay
svcsubproc.para: During the Self Diagnostic Test when starting the vehicle or if a failure occurs in the antilock system, the controller opens the ground path for the warning light relay coil causing it to de-energize, resulting in the illumination of the yellow instrument panel warning light.

note.para: If the antilock system is operating properly during normal vehicle operation, the lamp will not be illuminated.
